page.title: 10Commuting from Wimbish
page.content: In 1985 a commuter is a person who travels by train or car from home, which is usually outside a city, to work, which is usually in a city. I travel in the car 8 miles to Audley End railway station in time to catch the 8.08am. train to London. The journey is a fast one, taking just under an hour. On the train I sometimes work, or read the newspaper. Some days the train is so crowded that I have to stand all the way to the terminus at Liverpool Street. I arrive at work at about 9.30am. I work all day, with a short break morning and afternoon, and an hour for lunch. Being a married woman with a family I often go shopping at lunchtime. At 5.30pm I lock up and catch the train home. Often I am so tired that I sleep for part of the journey. I try to relax in the evenings before bedtime.
